card.name: Aerial Caravan
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. (Reveal the card as you exile it.)
card.flavor: Successful delivery is not guaranteed.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you do not play the card by end of turn, it remains exiled. If you play it, it goes wherever the it would normally go when played.

card.name: Afterlife
card.ability: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Alabaster Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Its mortar is mixed with waters straight from the Fountain of Cho.

card.name: Alley Grifters
card.ability: Whenever Alley Grifters becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.
card.flavor: One distracts the victim, the other extracts the valuables.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Ancestral Mask
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other enchantment on the battlefield.
card.flavor: The masks, like the ancient trees they're grown from, lend strength to the dryads.

card.name: Armistice
card.ability: {3}{W}{W}: You draw a card and target opponent gains 3 life.
card.flavor:
We all must profit for peace to last.
—Mercadian saying

card.name: Arms Dealer
card.ability: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: He has the weapons, he has the connections, and he knows the hangar's dark secret.
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : You can sacrifice Arms Dealer to activate its own ability.

card.name: Arrest
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
card.flavor: Orim had no memory of the previous night—the first thing she could remember was waking up with the dead guard's blood on her hands.

card.name: Assembly Hall
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Reveal a creature card in your hand. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a card if you do not want to.

card.name: Ballista Squad
card.ability: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.

card.name: Balloon Peddler
card.ability: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: The market festival turned out to be the high point of Jaffy's visit.

card.name: Barbed Wire
card.ability:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Barbed Wire deals 1 damage to that player.
{2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt by Barbed Wire this turn.
card.flavor: A steel snake with ten thousand teeth.

card.name: Bargaining Table
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Draw a card. X is the number of cards in an opponent's hand.
card.flavor: Although it looks like a game, business around the table is deadly serious.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose an opponent on announcement. This is not targeted, but a choice is still made. This choice is made before determining the value for X that is used in the cost.

card.name: Battle Rampart
card.ability:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

card.name: Battle Squadron
card.ability:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.

card.name: Bifurcate
card.ability: Search your library for a permanent card with the same name as target nontoken creature and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Black Market
card.ability:
Whenever a creature dies, put a charge counter on Black Market.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Black Market.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Getting the mana is not optional.

card.name: Blaster Mage
card.ability: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target Wall.
card.flavor: "Don't get up. I'll show myself out."

card.name: Blockade Runner
card.ability: {U}: Blockade Runner is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: "I need to get back to Mercadia City," said Sisay. "We can get you there," the vizier answered. "Easily."

card.name: Blood Hound
card.ability:
Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Blood Hound.
At the beginning of your end step, remove all +1/+1 counters from Blood Hound.

card.name: Blood Oath
card.ability: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Blood Oath deals 3 damage to that player for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal.

card.name: Boa Constrictor
card.ability: {T}: Boa Constrictor gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Its eyes are bigger than its stomach, but its mouth is larger still.

card.name: Bog Smugglers
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: They slide over the bog like oil across glass.

card.name: Bog Witch
card.ability: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability is a mana ability.

card.name: Brainstorm
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
card.flavor:
"I see more than others do because I know where to look."
—Saprazzan vizier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is all one effect. You draw 3 and return 2 cards all in one resolution. Nothing may happen between the two. If something triggers on drawing cards, it will go on the stack after Brainstorm finishes resolving.

card.name: Brawl
card.ability: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."
card.flavor: Anything can happen when patience is scarce and wine is abundant.

card.name: Briar Patch
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.

card.name: Bribery
card.ability: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You put the creature onto the battlefield, so you control it and any "enters the battlefield" abilities it has.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Buoyancy
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
card.flavor: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.

card.name: Cackling Witch
card.ability: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The touch of his madness can drive anyone into a killing frenzy.

card.name: Caller of the Hunt
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Caller of the Hunt, choose a creature type.
Caller of the Hunt's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures of the chosen type on the battlefield.

card.name: Cateran Brute
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The Cateran guild prefers to call them "public relations."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Enforcer
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Kidnappers
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Recruits aren't always volunteers.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Overlord
card.ability:
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Cateran Overlord.
{6}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Persuader
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 1 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Slaver
card.ability:
Swampwalk
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cateran Summons
card.ability: Search your library for a Mercenary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Even when recruitment is slow, the guild can always cook something up.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Caustic Wasps
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Caustic Wasps deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
card.flavor: Even the wasp knows how to pay the magistrate his due respect.

card.name: Cave Sense
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has mountainwalk.

card.name: Cave-In
card.ability:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Cave-In's mana cost.
Cave-In deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: One fleet was gone; others were poised.

card.name: Cavern Crawler
card.ability:
Mountainwalk
{R}: Cavern Crawler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

card.name: Ceremonial Guard
card.ability: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
card.flavor:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay

card.name: Chambered Nautilus
card.ability: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.

card.name: Chameleon Spirit
card.ability:
As Chameleon Spirit enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Chameleon Spirit's power and toughness are each equal to the number of permanents of the chosen color your opponents control.

card.name: Charisma
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, gain control of the other creature for as long as Charisma remains on the battlefield.
card.flavor: It was Gerrard's nature to lead and the Mercadians' to follow.

card.name: Charm Peddler
card.ability: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Charmed Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
When Charmed Griffin enters the battlefield, each other player may put an artifact or enchantment card onto the battlefield from his or her hand.
card.flavor: Are you sure you can afford such a luxury?

card.name: Cho-Arrim Alchemist
card.ability: {1}{W}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

card.name: Cho-Arrim Bruiser
card.ability: Whenever Cho-Arrim Bruiser attacks, you may tap up to two target creatures.
card.flavor: He doesn't know why the Cho-Arrim fight the Mercadians, but he's happy to bash heads for them anyway.

card.name: Cho-Arrim Legate
card.ability:
Protection from black
If an opponent controls a Swamp and you control a Plains, you may cast Cho-Arrim Legate without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.
card.flavor:
"Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."
—Cho-Manno

card.name: Cho-Manno's Blessing
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
As Cho-Manno's Blessing enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Cho-Manno's Blessing.

card.name: Cinder Elemental
card.ability: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.

card.name: Clear the Land
card.ability: Each player reveals the top five cards of his or her library, puts all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield tapped, and exiles the rest.

card.name: Close Quarters
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The Mercadians' ineptitude in close combat sometimes accidentally pays off.

card.name: Cloud Sprite
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

card.name: Coastal Piracy
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You draw one card per creature, not one per point of damage.

card.name: Collective Unconscious
card.ability: Draw a card for each creature you control.
card.flavor: Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.

card.name: Common Cause
card.ability: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.
card.flavor: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It really does mean "all creatures", including your opponent's.
10/4/2004 : The ability gives +2/+2 to all creatures which are not artifact creatures, as long as every one of those creatures is of the same color. They can have additional colors beyond the one they share, but they all have to share one color. If any creature is not of the shared color, the bonus is lost.

card.name: Conspiracy
card.ability:
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does not replace any use of creature types in card text.
10/4/2004 : This can grant a creature type to animated lands and artifacts that would otherwise have no creature type.
8/1/2005 : "Legend" is no longer a creature type, and may not be chosen.
8/1/2005 : If you choose Wall, then your creatures can still attack because creature types don't confer abilities such as Defender (any more than, say, choosing creature type Bird would confer Flying).

card.name: Cornered Market
card.ability:
Players can't cast spells with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
Players can't play nonbasic lands with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
card.flavor:
Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.
—Mercadian saying
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Cornered Market does not prevent effects which put a card onto the battlefield. It only stops people from casting.
10/4/2004 : This card only looks at permanents, not spells on the stack. So it is possible to cast two instances of a spell onto the stack.

card.name: Corrupt Official
card.ability:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random.
card.flavor: His favor comes at a high price.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.
card.flavor:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier

card.name: Cowardice
card.ability: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)
card.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.

card.name: Crackdown
card.ability: Nonwhite creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"There is no place for mercy in defense of our lives."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

card.name: Crag Saurian
card.ability: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.
card.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

card.name: Crash
card.ability:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Crash's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."

card.name: Credit Voucher
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Credit Voucher: Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

card.name: Crenellated Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Mercadian soldiers excel at finding things to stand behind.

card.name: Crooked Scales
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy target creature you control unless you pay {3} and repeat this process.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you pay the {3}, you do not choose a new pair of targets when it repeats. This means that if you lose the flip, you have the choice of having your creature destroyed or paying {3} to try again to win the flip. If you lose again, you get the same choice, and so on. You can keep trying to destroy your opponent's creature as long as you have mana to pay.
10/4/2004 : You choose both targets on activation, so you can only activate this when you can legally choose both targets.

card.name: Crossbow Infantry
card.ability: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: The crossbow is the ideal weapon for the lazy Mercadians: just point and shoot.

card.name: Crumbling Sanctuary
card.ability: If damage would be dealt to a player, that player exiles that many cards from the top of his or her library instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have no cards in your library, then damage done to you will have no effect since it will get changed into a removal that can't happen.
10/4/2004 : The ability affects all players.

card.name: Customs Depot
card.ability: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Eye of twilight, give us sight.
Take our offer, give us might.
Make our power tears of night."

card.name: Darting Merfolk
card.ability: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: You might as well try to catch water with a net.

card.name: Dawnstrider
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor: Morning's mists can hide many things.

card.name: Deadly Insect
card.ability: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.

card.name: Deathgazer
card.ability: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

card.name: Deepwood Drummer
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

card.name: Deepwood Elder
card.ability: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.
card.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

card.name: Deepwood Ghoul
card.ability: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
card.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.

card.name: Deepwood Legate
card.ability:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Deepwood Tantiv
card.ability: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

card.name: Deepwood Wolverine
card.ability: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

card.name: Dehydration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay

card.name: Delraich
card.ability:
Trample
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay Delraich's mana cost.
card.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

card.name: Desert Twister
card.ability: Destroy target permanent.
card.flavor: The magical dust clouds Mercadian mages use to traverse the plane generate storms that devastate the surrounding terrain. But as long as the storms don't touch the mountain, the nobles simply don't care.

card.name: Devout Witness
card.ability: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.

card.name: Diplomatic Escort
card.ability: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.

card.name: Diplomatic Immunity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Enchanted creature has shroud.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Shroud does not apply until after it is on the battlefield, so it can be the target of a spell while it is on the stack.

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
The scepter of power is fragile in a calloused hand.
—Cho-Arrim saying
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Distorting Lens
card.ability: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: The magistrate seems to prefer a distorted perspective of reality.

card.name: Drake Hatchling
card.ability:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.

card.name: Dust Bowl
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target nonbasic land.

card.name: Embargo
card.ability:
Nonland permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.

card.name: Energy Flux
card.ability: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
card.flavor: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.

card.name: Enslaved Horror
card.ability: When Enslaved Horror enters the battlefield, each other player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Erithizon
card.ability: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.
card.flavor: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Erithizon's controller controls the triggered ability, but their opponent chooses the target.

card.name: Extortion
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.
card.flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.

card.name: Extravagant Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.
card.flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.

card.name: Eye of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Ramos wept, and there were seas.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

card.name: False Demise
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: "Go down there and fish him out. Maybe his hide will fetch a price."

card.name: Ferocity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"You lot go on ahead. I'll keep killing them until it sticks."
—Tahngarth

card.name: Flailing Manticore
card.ability:
Flying, first strike
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Flailing Ogre
card.ability:
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Flailing Soldier
card.ability:
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Flaming Sword
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
card.flavor:
"It's not Talruum crystal, but I must admit—it gets the job done."
—Tahngarth

card.name: Food Chain
card.ability: Exile a creature you control: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the exiled creature's converted mana cost plus one. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This mana may not be used to pay costs imposed after the spell is initially cast.
10/4/2004 : This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.

card.name: Forced March
card.ability: Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost X or less.
card.flavor: The Caterans call it a screening process. The dead are in no condition to argue.

card.name: Foster
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Fountain of Cho
card.ability:
Fountain of Cho enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Fountain of Cho.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Fountain of Cho: Add {W} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

card.name: Fountain Watch
card.ability: Artifacts and enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.

card.name: Fresh Volunteers
card.flavor: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.

card.name: Furious Assault
card.ability: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor:
"Does it burn, Saprazzan? Do you wish you had never raised arms against us?"
—Kyren overseer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose a different target player each time this triggers.

card.name: Game Preserve
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards onto the battlefield under their owners' control.

card.name: General's Regalia
card.ability: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.
card.flavor: A uniform fit for a goblin.

card.name: Gerrard's Irregulars
card.ability: Trample, haste
card.flavor: Had Gerrard realized he'd end up fighting against them, he might not have trained them so well.

card.name: Ghoul's Feast
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."

card.name: Giant Caterpillar
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

card.name: Glowing Anemone
card.ability: When Glowing Anemone enters the battlefield, you may return target land to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Beautiful to behold, terrible to be held.

card.name: Groundskeeper
card.ability: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Whereas the rebels fight to defend the land, they work to renew it.

card.name: Gush
card.ability:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Gush's mana cost.
Draw two cards.
card.flavor: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.

card.name: Hammer Mage
card.ability: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy all artifacts with converted mana cost X or less.
card.flavor: When he's holding the hammers, everything looks like a nail.

card.name: Haunted Crossroads
card.ability: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.

card.name: Heart of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Ramos bled, and there was fire.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

card.name: Henge Guardian
card.ability: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: Like so many Thran relics, the wurm engine kept operating long after its creators were gone.

card.name: Henge of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
It is the hub. We are the wheel.
—Dryad saying

card.name: Hickory Woodlot
card.ability:
Hickory Woodlot enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Hickory Woodlot: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Hickory Woodlot, sacrifice it.

card.name: High Market
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.

card.name: High Seas
card.ability: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying

card.name: Highway Robber
card.ability: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."

card.name: Hired Giant
card.ability: When Hired Giant enters the battlefield, each other player may search his or her library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

card.name: Honor the Fallen
card.ability: Exile all creature cards from all graveyards. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way.
card.flavor:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

card.name: Hoodwink
card.ability: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.

card.name: Horn of Plenty
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, he or she may pay {1}. If that player does, he or she draws a card at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"This horn is an exact replica of the fabled Horn of Ramos, except mine is more lavish."
—Mercadian magistrate

card.name: Horn of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Ramos touched, and there was life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

card.name: Horned Troll
card.ability: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.
card.flavor:
"If I says it's a troll, it's a troll. Goblins is always right in Mercadia."
—Squee

card.name: Howling Wolf
card.ability: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

card.name: Hunted Wumpus
card.ability: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

card.name: Ignoble Soldier
card.ability: Whenever Ignoble Soldier becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn.
card.flavor: Cowardice is a term invented by those with no cunning.

card.name: Indentured Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn enters the battlefield, each other player may draw up to three cards.
card.flavor: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.

card.name: Instigator
card.ability: {1}{B}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
card.flavor: The desecration of their dead makes even the Saprazzans careless.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : There is no penalty if the creatures are unable to attack.

card.name: Insubordination
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, Insubordination deals 2 damage to that player unless that creature attacked this turn.

card.name: Intimidation
card.ability: Creatures you control have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: "If they move, kill them. In fact, kill one now to make sure the other understands."

card.name: Invigorate
card.ability:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay Invigorate's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

card.name: Inviolability
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature.
card.flavor: A soldier's faith is magic strong enough to protect against any blade.

card.name: Iron Lance
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The only way to get Mercadians to fight on the front lines is to give them really long weapons."
—Gerrard

card.name: Ivory Mask
card.ability: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: "I did not choose my role, Orim," said Cho-Manno patiently, "and I suspect Gerrard did not choose his."

card.name: Jeweled Torque
card.ability:
As Jeweled Torque enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.

card.name: Jhovall Queen
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: War-trained jhovalls eat twice their weight in war-trained soldiers daily.

card.name: Jhovall Rider
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.

card.name: Karn's Touch
card.ability: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Kris Mage
card.ability: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.

card.name: Kyren Archive
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile the top card of your library face down.
{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards exiled with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.

card.name: Kyren Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.
card.flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.

card.name: Kyren Legate
card.ability:
Haste
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Mountain, you may cast Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Kyren Negotiations
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.

card.name: Kyren Sniper
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.

card.name: Kyren Toy
card.ability:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add {X}{1} to your mana pool.

card.name: Land Grant
card.ability:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand rather than pay Land Grant's mana cost.
Search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can pay the "reveal your hand" cost even if your hand is already revealed due to another effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Larceny
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Triggers once per creature, not once per point of damage.

card.name: Last Breath
card.ability: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.
card.flavor: "The River flows. My soul returns."

card.name: Lava Runner
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.

card.name: Ley Line
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of his or her choice.
card.flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard

card.name: Liability
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.
card.flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.

card.name: Lightning Hounds
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.

card.name: Lithophage
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a Mountain.
card.flavor: It's viciously territorial, destroying every creature on the mountain it has chosen to consume.

card.name: Lumbering Satyr
card.ability: All creatures have forestwalk.
card.flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying

card.name: Lunge
card.ability: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.flavor: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Maggot Therapy
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
card.flavor:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."
—Orim

card.name: Magistrate's Scepter
card.ability:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take an extra turn after this one.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Magistrate's Veto
card.ability: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.
card.flavor: The magistrate had been the goblins' puppet for so long that he made the right decisions with little prompting.

card.name: Megatherium
card.ability:
Trample
When Megatherium enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

card.name: Mercadian Atlas
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only checks if you played a land. Putting a land onto the battlefield by using an effect of another card does not count as "playing a land".

card.name: Mercadian Bazaar
card.ability:
Mercadian Bazaar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

card.name: Mercadian Lift
card.ability:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Mercadia's Downfall
card.ability: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.
card.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creatures that are attacking is determined when this resolves and is not changed later, even if you have another combat phase.

card.name: Midnight Ritual
card.ability: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.

card.name: Misdirection
card.ability:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Misdirection's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
10/4/2004 : This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
10/4/2004 : The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
10/4/2004 : You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
10/4/2004 : If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
10/4/2004 : This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
10/4/2004 : You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.

card.name: Misshapen Fiend
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

card.name: Misstep
card.ability: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.
card.flavor:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
8/1/2008 : No creature controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes creatures which entered the battlefield after Misstep resolved.

card.name: Molting Harpy
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.
card.flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.

card.name: Moment of Silence
card.ability: Target player skips his or her next combat phase this turn.
card.flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The player skips their next combat phase this turn (if any). If they manage to have two combat phases, then only their next one combat phase is skipped.
10/4/2004 : It must be used before the combat phase starts or it has no effect.
10/4/2004 : If cast on a player when it is not their turn, it has no effect.

card.name: Monkey Cage
card.ability: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put X 2/2 green Ape creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

card.name: Moonlit Wake
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

card.name: Muzzle
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying

card.name: Natural Affinity
card.ability: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Nether Spirit
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.
card.flavor: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.

card.name: Nightwind Glider
card.ability: Flying, protection from black
card.flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.

card.name: Noble Purpose
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

card.name: Notorious Assassin
card.ability: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.

card.name: Ogre Taskmaster
card.ability: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
card.flavor: He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.

card.name: Orim's Cure
card.ability:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Orim's Cure's mana cost.
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Overtaker
card.ability: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."

card.name: Panacea
card.ability: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.

card.name: Pangosaur
card.ability: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

card.name: Peat Bog
card.ability:
Peat Bog enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Peat Bog: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Peat Bog, sacrifice it.

card.name: Pious Warrior
card.ability: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.

card.name: Port Inspector
card.ability: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.
card.flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."

card.name: Power Matrix
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.

card.name: Pretender's Claim
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.
card.flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.

card.name: Primeval Shambler
card.ability: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

card.name: Puffer Extract
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.

card.name: Pulverize
card.ability:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Pulverize's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.

card.name: Puppet's Verdict
card.ability: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
card.flavor:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate

card.name: Putrefaction
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.
card.flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

card.name: Quagmire Lamprey
card.ability: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

card.name: Rain of Tears
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.

card.name: Ramosian Captain
card.ability:
First strike
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim believe in leading by example.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ramosian Commander
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "Cho-Manno guides your spirit. I guide your sword."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ramosian Lieutenant
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "Give me your hand and I will give you victory."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ramosian Rally
card.ability:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Ramosian Rally's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Ramosian Sergeant
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Her commands are part rallying cry, part sermon, and wholly undeniable.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ramosian Sky Marshal
card.ability:
Flying
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fell from the sky onto Mercadia City like a vengeful rain.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rampart Crawler
card.ability: Rampart Crawler can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor:
"Not even the magistrate in his lofty tower is out of our reach."
—Cateran overlord

card.name: Rappelling Scouts
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{W}: Rappelling Scouts gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

card.name: Remote Farm
card.ability:
Remote Farm enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Remote Farm: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Remote Farm, sacrifice it.

card.name: Renounce
card.ability: Sacrifice any number of permanents. You gain 2 life for each permanent sacrificed this way.
card.flavor: Gerrard offered no defense to Orim's condemnation; the mission was under his command, and he was responsible.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose what to sacrifice on resolution.

card.name: Revered Elder
card.ability: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim worship life and revere those who've experienced it longest.

card.name: Reverent Mantra
card.ability:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Reverent Mantra's mana cost.
Choose a color. All creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

card.name: Revive
card.ability: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Gerrard's heart ached, recalling the living wreath Mirri laid for her dead kin. No such memorial was left for her in Rath.

card.name: Righteous Aura
card.ability: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor:
"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno

card.name: Righteous Indignation
card.ability: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."

card.name: Rishadan Airship
card.ability:
Flying
Rishadan Airship can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.

card.name: Rishadan Brigand
card.ability:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {3}.
Rishadan Brigand can block only creatures with flying.

card.name: Rishadan Cutpurse
card.ability: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.
card.flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying

card.name: Rishadan Footpad
card.ability: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {2}.
card.flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."

card.name: Rishadan Pawnshop
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.
card.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.

card.name: Rishadan Port
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.
card.flavor: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

card.name: Robber Fly
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
card.flavor: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Rock Badger
card.ability: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
card.flavor: The Kyren goblins created most of the inverted mountain's tunnels simply by driving the beast before them.

card.name: Rouse
card.ability:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 2 life rather than pay Rouse's mana cost.
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Rushwood Dryad
card.ability: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor: Rushwood is a living jewel that reflects its dwellers' hearts.

card.name: Rushwood Elemental
card.ability:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rushwood Elemental.

card.name: Rushwood Grove
card.ability:
Rushwood Grove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Rushwood Grove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Rushwood Grove: Add {G} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

card.name: Rushwood Herbalist
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.

card.name: Rushwood Legate
card.ability: If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Forest, you may cast Rushwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Saber Ants
card.ability: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: They stay on the battlefield only long enough to consume the losers.

card.name: Sacred Prey
card.ability: Whenever Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: To see one is a good omen to the Cho-Arrim.

card.name: Sailmonger
card.ability: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: Clients who cheat the sailmonger make an impact on the rest.

card.name: Sand Squid
card.ability:
Islandwalk
You may choose not to untap Sand Squid during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Sand Squid remains tapped.

card.name: Sandstone Needle
card.ability:
Sandstone Needle enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Sandstone Needle: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Sandstone Needle, sacrifice it.

card.name: Saprazzan Bailiff
card.ability:
When Saprazzan Bailiff enters the battlefield, exile all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards.
When Saprazzan Bailiff leaves the battlefield, return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.

card.name: Saprazzan Breaker
card.ability: {U}: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, Saprazzan Breaker is unblockable this turn.

card.name: Saprazzan Cove
card.ability:
Saprazzan Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Saprazzan Cove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Saprazzan Cove: Add {U} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

card.name: Saprazzan Heir
card.ability: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.
card.flavor: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers only once even if blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Saprazzan Legate
card.ability:
Flying
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control an Island, you may cast Saprazzan Legate without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Saprazzan Outrigger
card.ability: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.
card.flavor: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit and run.

card.name: Saprazzan Raider
card.ability: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Some quick dagger work and then back to the sea—that's the Saprazzan way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It returns as soon as it is blocked. It does not remain on the battlefield long enough to deal damage.

card.name: Saprazzan Skerry
card.ability:
Saprazzan Skerry enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Saprazzan Skerry: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Saprazzan Skerry, sacrifice it.

card.name: Scandalmonger
card.ability: {2}: Target player discards a card. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.

card.name: Security Detail
card.ability: {W}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if you control no creatures and only once each turn.

card.name: Seismic Mage
card.ability: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: The ground shakes when he walks. His customers shake if they're late with his fee.

card.name: Sever Soul
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor:
"With the proper tools, even the Great River can be dammed."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

card.name: Shock Troops
card.ability: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: When goblins blow themselves up, it's called stupidity. When humans do, it's called heroism.

card.name: Shoving Match
card.ability: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."
card.flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.

card.name: Silent Assassin
card.ability: {3}{B}: Destroy target blocking creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: She feels no need to disturb her victim's slumber.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you activate the ability during the end of combat step, the creature will be destroyed at the beginning of the next end of combat step, even if that step occurs during a different turn.

card.name: Silverglade Elemental
card.ability: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Silverglade Pathfinder
card.ability: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Sizzle
card.ability: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.
card.flavor: Explosions ripped through the ship overhead, and those unfortunate enough to be directly below scrambled to find cover.

card.name: Skulking Fugitive
card.ability: When Skulking Fugitive becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
card.flavor: In the Cateran guild, being caught is a capital offense.

card.name: Skull of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Skull of Ramos: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Ramos fell, and there was night.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

card.name: Snake Pit
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a 1/1 green Snake creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
If the ground is smooth, the way will be rough.
—Deepwood saying

card.name: Snorting Gahr
card.ability: Whenever Snorting Gahr becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: There's little advantage to surprising the gahr.

card.name: Snuff Out
card.ability:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 4 life rather than pay Snuff Out's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Squee watched his Kyren cousins fall with a mixture of sympathy and relief.

card.name: Soothing Balm
card.ability: Target player gains 5 life.
card.flavor: Orim taught Ta-Karnst and the other Cho-Arrim healers a far less invasive method of healing.

card.name: Soothsaying
card.ability:
{3}{U}{U}: Shuffle your library.
{X}: Look at the top X cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor: The vizier's wisdom proved invaluable in untangling the Mercadian knot of lies.

card.name: Soul Channeling
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Pay 2 life: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.flavor: Driven by masters more terrible than the Mercadians could imagine, the dark overseers would pay any price to keep their shipwrights working.

card.name: Specter's Wail
card.ability: Target player discards a card at random.
card.flavor: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.

card.name: Spidersilk Armor
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It hardly weighs anything, but it takes all day to remove.

card.name: Spiritual Focus
card.ability: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard a card, you gain 2 life and you may draw a card.

card.name: Spontaneous Generation
card.ability: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each card in your hand.
card.flavor: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.

card.name: Squall
card.ability: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor: The air that holds them aloft can just as easily put them down.

card.name: Squallmonger
card.ability: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."

card.name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return Squee, Goblin Nabob from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "General?" Tahngarth roared. "General nuisance, maybe."

card.name: Squeeze
card.ability: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to cast.
card.flavor: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.

card.name: Stamina
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
Sacrifice Stamina: Regenerate enchanted creature.

card.name: Statecraft
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.
card.flavor:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier

card.name: Steadfast Guard
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor: The Mercadians were prepared for the guard, but the guard was even more prepared for the Mercadians.

card.name: Stinging Barrier
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}, {T}: Stinging Barrier deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: The return of Ramos was foretold by devastating natural disasters and unnatural storms.

card.name: Story Circle
card.ability:
As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Strongarm Thug
card.ability: When Strongarm Thug enters the battlefield, you may return target Mercenary card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "No, I insist—let me carry all that heavy jewelry."

card.name: Subterranean Hangar
card.ability:
Subterranean Hangar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Subterranean Hangar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Subterranean Hangar: Add {B} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

card.name: Sustenance
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Like the dryads, the forest itself willingly gives up some of its life for the sake of the future.

card.name: Task Force
card.ability: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The +0/+3 bonus is added as a triggered ability upon the casting/activating of a spell or ability which targets this card.

card.name: Tectonic Break
card.ability: Each player sacrifices X lands.
card.flavor: Only the foolish and the rich build their houses where the land is thin and the ocean is near.

card.name: Territorial Dispute
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Territorial Dispute unless you sacrifice a land.
Players can't play lands.
card.flavor: Bit by bit, Mercadia City had forced the Cho-Arrim from their ancestral lands. They would be pushed no further.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does not stop lands from being put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability. It only stops players from taking the action of playing a land.

card.name: Thermal Glider
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor:
"The Mercadians are too busy looking down on us to see us coming."
—Cho-Arrim rebel

card.name: Thieves' Auction
card.ability: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
10/4/2004 : An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
10/4/2004 : Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
10/4/2004 : You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.
8/1/2005 : If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

card.name: Thrashing Wumpus
card.ability: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.

card.name: Thunderclap
card.ability:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Thunderclap's mana cost.
Thunderclap deals 3 damage to target creature.

card.name: Thwart
card.ability:
You may return three Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Thwart's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

card.name: Tidal Bore
card.ability:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Tidal Bore's mana cost.
You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.

card.name: Tidal Kraken
card.ability: Tidal Kraken is unblockable.
card.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

card.name: Tiger Claws
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
card.flavor: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.

card.name: Timid Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It flees from anything that isn't shaped like a cloud.

card.name: Tonic Peddler
card.ability: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target player gains 3 life.
card.flavor: "The price is written at the bottom of the cup."

card.name: Tooth of Ramos
card.ability:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Ramos smiled, and there was day.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

card.name: Tower of the Magistrate
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from artifacts until end of turn.
card.flavor: Like the city, weakest at its foundation.

card.name: Toymaker
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Trade Routes
card.ability:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: Like the price of goods, the value of the routes was renegotiated daily.

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.
card.flavor: Sisay had been restored to her place on the ship, the Legacy had been recovered, and the Weatherlight was sailing home to Dominaria. Gerrard focused on the debts he'd settled . . . and on those he'd soon collect.

card.name: Trap Runner
card.ability: {T}: Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. Activate this ability only during combat after blockers are declared. (This ability works on unblockable creatures.)
card.flavor: "How could I catch her when the trees conspired to stop me?"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the ability is used on a creature with Trample, the damage still comes through.
10/4/2004 : This ability will trigger any creature's "whenever this becomes blocked" ability.

card.name: Tremor
card.ability: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor: Without a word, Gerrard and Sisay ran deeper into the mountain. Neither of them intended to leave Mercadia without the Weatherlight and its crew.

card.name: Two-Headed Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Two-Headed Dragon can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature.

card.name: Undertaker
card.ability: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The weight of death is heavy but not immovable.

card.name: Unmask
card.ability:
You may exile a black card from your hand rather than pay Unmask's mana cost.
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

card.name: Unnatural Hunger
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Unnatural Hunger deals damage to that player equal to that creature's power unless he or she sacrifices another creature.

card.name: Uphill Battle
card.ability: Creatures played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: Cho-Manno knew he had no choice but to ally with Gerrard. If that's what it took to free his people, he'd pay the price.

card.name: Vendetta
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.
card.ruling:
6/15/2010 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Vendetta resolves, the spell is countered. You won't lose life.
6/15/2010 : The destroyed creature's last existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.
6/15/2010 : If the targeted creature isn't destroyed due to totem armor's effect, Vendetta continues to resolve. You lose life equal to the creature's current toughness (after the Aura with totem armor has been destroyed).

card.name: Venomous Breath
card.ability: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
