card.flavor: The dryads need neither size nor strength to defeat their enemies in battle.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It affects creatures that had blocked the target when this spell resolves, even if they are no longer blocking the creature.

card.name: Venomous Dragonfly
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Venomous Dragonfly blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: A pretty little death is still death.

card.name: Vernal Equinox
card.ability: Any player may cast creature and enchantment cards as though they had flash.

card.name: Vine Dryad
card.ability:
Flash
Forestwalk
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Vine Dryad's mana cost.

card.name: Vine Trellis
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "We protect our own with our own."

card.name: Volcanic Wind
card.ability: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures on the battlefield as you cast Volcanic Wind.
card.flavor: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The value of X is determined at the time you announce this spell, and you choose the targets and the division of damage among those targets as part of the announcement as well.
10/4/2004 : If there are no creatures on the battlefield when you cast this, you do not pick any targets and it deals no damage.
10/4/2004 : If there is at least one creature on the battlefield when you are announcing this, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets.

card.name: Wall of Distortion
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: It reflects only nightmares.

card.name: War Cadence
card.ability: {X}{R}: This turn, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature he or she controls.
card.flavor: The rhythm isn't a call to arms, but a signal that the goblins have made a new enemy.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't block unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid). You can use this to make your creatures unable to block an attacker.
10/4/2004 : The ability only applies to blocks declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any blockers already announced.

card.name: War Tax
card.ability: {X}{U}: This turn, creatures can't attack unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature he or she controls.
card.flavor: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can choose X=0. This doesn't have an effect most of the time, but it does mean that creatures can't attack unless the controller chooses to pay the cost (a cost of zero is not automatically paid, so the controller can choose to not pay).
10/4/2004 : The ability only applies to attackers declared after it resolves. It will not add costs to any attackers already announced.
2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

card.name: Warmonger
card.ability: {2}: Warmonger deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: Funny how money and war travel so well together.

card.name: Warpath
card.ability: Warpath deals 3 damage to each blocking creature and each blocked creature.
card.flavor: Cho-Manno had never seen Mercadia City's forces fight so well. The magistrate must have hired a new hero.

card.name: Waterfront Bouncer
card.ability: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.

card.name: Wave of Reckoning
card.ability: Each creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
card.flavor: Inner conflict can defeat a soldier more quickly than any army.

card.name: Wild Jhovall
card.flavor: Jhovalls sharpen their claws on trees—or on Mercadians, if no trees are handy.

card.name: Wishmonger
card.ability: {2}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: "It's not what you ask for, but how you ask for it."

card.name: Word of Blasting
card.ability: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.

card.name: Worry Beads
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
